medical_history.chief_complaint: Epidural hematoma developed after a trivial fall.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began immediately after the child fell backward while trying to stand and struck his head on a carpeted floor. He cried and was irritable at first, then vomited twice and continued to act irritable. Neurological status rapidly deteriorated, requiring endotracheal intubation and ventilatory support.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The child has osteogenesis imperfecta (OI) and had a history of a spiral fracture of the right femur at 5 months of age, with additional fractures identified on CT scans at T-9, T-10, T-12, and L-1. Previous child protection proceedings were undertaken due to suspected child abuse.
medical_history.family_history: There was no family history of osteogenesis imperfecta.
medical_history.social_history: The child was placed in foster care due to suspicions of child abuse, which were later overturned after genetic testing confirmed OI. Not specified after this context.
